Results: The hosts Australia beat South Korea in the final 2-1 (aet)
The Ivory Coast won the tournament for their 2nd title, defeating Ghana 9–8 in a penalty shoot-out.
Djokovic won a record fifth Australian Open title, and Serena Williams won her sixth title.
nearly 1500 athletes competed
won by the New England Patriots, who beat the Seattle Seahawks 28 to 24
Athletes from Austria dominated the medal tally
42 countries participated
Australia defeated New Zealand in the final for their 5th title.
France led the medal tally with 5 golds, but Australia won the most medals overall (11)
Jordan Spieth led from the start, shooting a record-tying 270 (18 under) to win his first major at the age of 21.
won by Many Clouds, ridden by Leighton Aspell , Aspell's 2nd consecutive Grand National victory.
Won by American Pharaoh, the 4th win by trainer Bob Baffert and the third win for jockey Victor Espinoza.
Serena Williams won her third title. Nadal's winning streak was beaten by Djokovic in the quarters, who was then beaten by Wawrinka in the final.
Arsenal defeated Aston Villa 4–0
Chicago Blackhawks defeated Tampa Bay Lightning 4 games to 2, to win their 6th championship in franchise history, and their 3rd title in 6 seasons.
Golden State Warriors capped off memorable season with its first championship in 40 years, defeating Cleveland Cavaliers 4-2.
370 athletes from 11 nations competed in the Games, with 402 events in 36 sports. Thailand won the most gold medals, hosts Singapore won the most medals overall.
Barcelona beat Juventus 3–1 to gain their fifth trophy
The winners were the USA, beating Japan 5-2, avenging their loss to Japan on penalties in the 2011 final.
The inaugural event featured almost 6,000 athletes from 50 countries competing in 20 sports. Russia easily led the medal tally.
Jordan Spieth won his first U.S. Open and consecutive major titles.
US athletes won the most medals, as did Law Enforcement over Firefighters.
Serbian Novak Djokovic won his 3rd title in men's singles, defending his title from 2014. Serena Williams won her sixth Wimbledon and 21st major title, defeating first-time finalist Garbiñe Muguruza.
South Korea won the most golds, but Russia won the most medals overall.
24 countries took part with the inclusion of Australia and New Zealand for the first time in the history of the Games, in 28 sports. Papua New Guinea led the medal table.
The winner was Chris Froome of Team Sky, his second win in three years.
over 6000 athletes representing 41 National Olympic Committees in 36 sports. USA led the medal table.
American Zach Johnson claimed his 2nd major title winning in a 3-way play off.
Most number of gold medals won was by China, the United States then Russia, the first time the US did not finish in first place in the medal standings since 2001. 12 world records were set.
a huge event with 6,500 athletes
Australia defeated New Zealand 58-55 to claim its third consecutive title
Australia's Jason Day claimed his first major win, finishing with a score of 20-under par, the lowest any player in the history of the sport has ever finished to par in a major championship.
The highlight was the showdown between sprinters Usain Bolt and Justin Gatlin, with Bolt the surprise winner in both the 100 and 200m. Kenya topped the medal table for the first time.

In the men's singles, Novak Djokovic beat Roger Federer in the final. In the women's event, three-time defending champion Serena Williams was looking to win her first grand slam, but lost in the semifinals to unseeded Roberta Vinci. Vinci subsequently was beaten in the final by Flavia Pennetta, who won her first Grand Slam championship.
Egypt led the meal table ahead of Nigeria and South Africa
won by New Zealand, a record third World Cup tournament win. They beat Australia in the final 34 to 17.
The USA were the most successful country with 8 medals.
Boxers in 10 weight categories from 73 countries. The most successful country was Cuba with 4 golds.

Location: Jack Nicklaus Golf Club Korea, Incheon, South Korea
Results: The United States won for the sixth successive time with a 15½–14½ victory over the International team
The US lead the medal table
Played between between New York Mets and Kansas City Royals. The Royals won the series 4 games to 1.
Michelle Payne had a historic win on Prince of Penzance, a 100-1 long-shot, becoming the first female jockey to win the race.
In the final, South Korea defeated United States 8–0 to win the first WBSC Premier12 title.
748 athletes, 113 federations and more than 105 countries. The leading nation was China with 6 golds.
